forward
Class ForwardMenu

java.lang.Object
  forward.ForwardMenu

public class ForwardMenu
extends java.lang.Object

copyright (c) 2009-2012 e-Amrita - Giampietro Zedda Turin (Italy)

ForwardMenu

This class models a generic menu.

The base is the most detailed menu description, a JMenuBar, including title, icons, key strokes and so on
and built with objects like JMenuItem, JCheckBoxMenuItem, JRadioButtonMenuItem and JSeparator.

According to menu rendering, the same menu description can produce a JPopupMenu, a JToolBar, a JList or
finally, a JTree.

Since:
21/nov/2011
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Giampietro Zedda
See Also:
ForwardPanel

getGraphicObject

public javax.swing.JComponent getGraphicObject()
Get the graphic object menu with wich the menu is implemented.

For menus on menu bar the object is a JMenu object.
For menus popup menus, the object is a JPopUpMenu object.

the menuObject

getMenuRendering

public EnumForwardOption getMenuRendering()
Get the menu rendering as coded by forward.

A menu can be realized with a toolbar, buttons, labels or classic menu items even in a popup menu.
The a menu can be realized with sections hiding by click or submenu appearing by mouse moving on the leaf menu item.

Returns:
the menuRendering

setMenuRendering

public void setMenuRendering(EnumForwardOption menuRendering)
Set the menu rendering as coded by forward.

A menu can be realized with a toolbar, buttons, labels or classic menu items even in a popup menu.
The a menu can be realized with sections hiding by click or submenu appearing by mouse moving on the leaf menu item.

Parameters:
menuType - the menuType to set
